skill.name: cellxgene-census
skill.description: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data, integrate with scanpy/PyTorch, for population-scale single-cell analysis.
skill.summary: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation and usage guidance only. No code performs file access, network calls, or execution. No malicious patterns were found.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant single cell data across millions of cells is slow and error prone. This skill guides precise Census queries and scalable analysis workflows.
actual_capabilities: Open Census versions with context manager for reproducible analysis
Query cell and gene metadata with value filters
Load AnnData for small to medium expression queries
Process large expression matrices with axis_query in batches
Create PyTorch dataloaders for model training
limitations: Requires the cellxgene-census Python package and dependencies
Only covers human and mouse data in the Census
Large queries can exceed local memory without batching
Results depend on the selected Census version

use_cases.title: Find cell types in tissue
use_cases.description: List cell types in a tissue and estimate cell counts before deeper analysis.

use_cases.title: Train cell type classifier
use_cases.description: Build a PyTorch dataloader from Census RNA data for model training.

use_cases.title: Cross tissue comparisons
use_cases.description: Compare gene expression across multiple tissues using consistent filters.

prompt_templates.title: Find cell types
prompt_templates.prompt: List unique cell types in human lung and include counts. Use primary data only.

prompt_templates.title: Marker genes query
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch AnnData for CD4, CD8A, and FOXP3 in T cells from lung. Include disease and donor metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Large batch stats
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute mean expression for FOXP2 and TBR1 in brain using axis_query batches. Use primary data only.

prompt_templates.title: Train dataloader
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PyTorch dataloader for liver cells with cell_type labels. Use batch size 128 and shuffle.

output_examples.input: Show me the main brain cell types and counts from primary data.
output: Filter used: tissue_general == brain and is_primary_data == True

best_practices: Include is_primary_data == True in most filters
Specify a Census version for reproducibility
Estimate query size before loading AnnData
anti_patterns: Loading large datasets without axis_query batching
Omitting context manager when opening the Census
Querying broad tissues without limiting columns

faq.question: Is this compatible with my environment?
faq.answer: It works with Python environments that can install cellxgene-census and dependencies.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Large queries can exceed memory without batching and only human and mouse data are available.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It integrates with scanpy and PyTorch workflows shown in the examples.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. The skill only provides guidance for querying the public Census dataset.

faq.question: What if my query returns too many cells?
faq.answer: Add stricter filters or use axis_query to process in batches.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic dataset search?
faq.answer: It targets the Census schema and query syntax for precise, large scale single cell analysis.
